trans-unit.source: Manages user interface in the designer.
This class cannot be inherited.
When the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService> is created, it adds a transparent window over the designer frame.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService> can then use this window to render user interface elements, called <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.Glyph> objects, as well as catch all mouse messages.
In this way, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService> can control designer behavior.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService> class supports a behavior stack, onto which <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.Behavior> objects can be pushed.

When a message is intercepted through the transparent window, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService> can send the message to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.Behavior> at the top of the stack.
This enables different user interface modes depending on the currently pushed <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.Behavior>.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService> is used to render all <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.Glyph> objects, such as selection borders, sizing handles, and smart tags.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService> also controls many design-time behaviors, such as using snaplines, dragging, and selecting.
For more information, see [Behavior Service Overview](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/7c60cc41-4324-46b5-b444-b39eda7cb33f).
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorServiceAdornerCollection"></xref>.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService.Adorners%2A> property provides access to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorServiceAdornerCollection> managed by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService>.
A collection of adorner.
Gets the <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> for the adorner window.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> for the adorner window.
Translates a <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> in the adorner window to screen coordinates.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> value to transform.
The transformed <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> value, in screen coordinates.
Gets the location of the adorner window in screen coordinates.
The location, from the upper-left corner of the adorner window, in screen coordinates.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService"></xref> starts a drag-and-drop operation.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService> raises the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService.BeginDrag> event immediately before it starts a drag-and-drop operation.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Returns the bounding <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> of a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control"></xref>.
The adorner window is a transparent window that resides on top of the designer's frame.
This window is used by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService> to intercept all messages.
It also serves as a unified canvas on which to paint a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.Glyph>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control"></xref> to translate.
The bounding <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> of a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control"></xref> translated to the adorner window coordinates.
Returns the location of a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control"></xref> translated to adorner window coordinates.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control"></xref> to translate.
A value indicating the location of c in adorner window coordinates.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.Behavior"></xref> at the top of the behavior stack without removing it.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.Behavior"></xref> at the top of the behavior stack.
Releases all resources used by the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService"></xref>.
Call <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService.Dispose%2A> when you are finished using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService.Dispose%2A> method leaves the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService> in an unusable state.

After calling <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService.Dispose%2A>, you must release all references to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService> so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService> was occupying.

For more information, see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md) and [Implementing a Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md).
Always call <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService.Dispose%2A> before you release your last reference to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService>.
Otherwise, the resources it is using will not be freed until the garbage collector calls the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService> object's `Finalize` method.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService"></xref> completes a drag operation.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService> raises the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService.EndDrag> event immediately after the drag operation is complete.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Returns the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.Behavior"></xref> immediately after the given <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.Behavior"></xref> in the behavior stack.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.Behavior"></xref> preceding the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.Behavior"></xref> to be returned.
The immediately after behavior in the behavior stack, or `null` if there is no following behavior.
Invalidates the adorner window of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService"></xref>.

Calling the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService.Invalidate%2A> method forces a refresh of all <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.Adorner> objects and, in turn, all <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.Glyph> objects.
Invalidates, within the adorner window, the specified area of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService"></xref>.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService.Invalidate%2A> method will force a refresh of all <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService.Adorners%2A> and, in turn, all <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.Adorner.Glyphs%2A>.
The rectangular area to invalidate.
Invalidates, within the adorner window, the specified area of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService"></xref>.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService.Invalidate%2A> method will force a refresh of all <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService.Adorners%2A> and, in turn, all <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.Adorner.Glyphs%2A>.
The region to invalidate.
Converts a point in a handle's coordinate system to the adorner window coordinates.
An adorner window's handle.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> in a handle's coordinate system.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> in the adorner window coordinates.
Removes and returns the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.Behavior"></xref> at the top of the stack.
Removes the current <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.Behavior> from the behavior stack internally maintained by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.Behavior"></xref> to remove from the stack.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.Behavior"></xref> that was removed from the stack.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.Behavior"></xref> stack is empty.
Pushes a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.Behavior"></xref> onto the behavior stack.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService.PushBehavior%2A> method is often performed by means of a hit-tested <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.Glyph>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.Behavior"></xref> to push.
behavior is `null`.
Pushes a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.Behavior"></xref> onto the behavior stack and assigns mouse capture to the behavior.
Pushing a capture behavior is often done through a hit-tested <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.Glyph>.

If a behavior calls the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService.PushCaptureBehavior%2A> method and mouse capture is lost, the behavior's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.Behavior.OnLoseCapture%2A> method is called.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.Behavior"></xref> to push.
behavior is `null`.
Translates a point in screen coordinates into the adorner window coordinates of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> value to transform.
The transformed <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> value, in adorner window coordinates.
Occurs when the current selection should be refreshed.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Synchronizes all selection glyphs.
